You can also add the history of the company or how you got started.

item.content:encoded:
Call For Paper for Law Review

Recent Updates-

  •  Call for Paper for Law Review is out now*
  • Call for write-up for Bulletin December 2020 Edition(deadline expired)
  • Movie Review Competition ended on 7 November
  • Deadline Extended for Annual Law  Review till 31st December*

Result: 1st JULSWC Legal Film Review Competition

  1. Winner: Abir Hasan Ananta
  2. 1st Runner-up: Md. Eshtiaque Hossain

item.title: Publications
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Publications

The best way to practice writing is through publication of different types of writing from different genre of practices. JULS Writing Club currently has two stream of publication projects. However, gradually, it expects to diversify its publication cabinet.

Half-Yearly Bulletins

Annual Law Review

item.title: About us
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
About Us:

Jahangirnagar University Law Society Writing Club

Jahangirnagar University Law Society (JULS) is a student run body that has four independent organs. The society was created by the Department of Law & Justice, Faculty of Law, Jahangirnagar University with the intention of involving and facilitating students into extra-curricular activities that will help them develop different social, cultural and professional skills. JULS Writing Club, as a federal part of JULS aims to grow as a benchmark of critical legal thinking among the legal minds of Bangladesh. It focuses on facilitating skill development opportunities, welcoming students and professionals from legal background to interact, discuss and come up with productive outcomes through writing, that can serve the community in general.

The Executive Team for 2019-20 Session:

President: Tapos Kumar Das

Advisor: Preeti Kana Sikdar

Secretary: Nadia Islam
Asst. Secretary: Md. Atiqul Islam Bhuiyan
Organizing Secretary: Rebeka Sultana
Asst. Org. Secretary: Jahidul Islam
Treasurer: Khan Rasul Bin Wali
Office Secretary: Tasnia Akter Laiba
Program Secretary: Anika Nargis
Publication Secretary: Mehenaj Binte Amin

Executive member: Tanusree Devi Asha
Executive member: Nusrat Jahan meem
Executive member: Afrin Sultana Mohona
Executive member: Tasmeem Sultana Kheya

item.title: Public Lecture Series
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
PUBLIC LECTURE SERIES

JULS Writing Club aims to develop the critical intellect and research skills of students. With this aim in mind, the club offers a series of public lectures on different legal issues for its pupils.

The Gender of Constitutional Jurisprudence

The very first project of the Public Lecture Series by JULSWC was held through celebrating the International Women’s Day. Approximately 60 students were………more

item.title: Half Yearly Bulletin
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Half Yearly Bulletin


The JULS Writing Club published two periodicals in a year named Half Yearly Bulletin. It publishes legal pieces that have the classic Doctrinal or critical interdisciplinary approach to look and dissect into contemporary issues evolved in the legal arena. Submissions for the Half Yearly Bulletin opens two times in a year for a limited period.
 

 

Read our author guidelines

Call For Write-up (December Edition)

We are grateful to the audience as they recognised  the Bulletin June 2020 Edition with immense appreciation. We feel majestic to announce that we are accepting submission for December 2020 Edition....more

Half Yearly Bulletin June Edition 2020

Law is a discipline where the language is crucial. Language has to be precise, adequate and unambiguous in the legal discourse. To master the language as a skill, there is no match to the habit of writing. Therefore, writing it was, that JULS Writing Club endeavoured to encourage law students into.... more

item.title: THE GENDER OF CONSTITUTIONAL JURISPRUDENCE
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
THE GENDER
OF CONSTITUTIONAL JURISPRUDENCE

Synopsis :

The very first project of the Public Lecture Series by JULSWC was held through celebrating the International  Women’s Day. Approximately  60 students were present in the event.  Dr. SM Masum Billah, Associate Professor, Jagannath University was invited as a resource  person to conduct the lecture.
Throughout the lecture, Dr. SM Masum Billah aptly portrayed his thoughts and ideas on the place of ‘she’ in the constitution. Sometimes the loopholes  of the constitution may become the reason of violation of any lae. The young generation  needs to open up their minds to see these loopholes of the Constitution. Therefore, Gender discrimination  must be minimized through the language of the Constitution itself!.

Date and Venue :
8th March, 2020.
Social-Science Faculty

About speaker :
Dr. S M Masum Billah,
Associate Professor,
Jagannath University

Visit Our event page:
JULS Writing Club Public Lecture Series

item.title: BASIC WORKSHOP ON LEGAL RESEARCH AND WRITING TECHNIQUES
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
BASIC WORKSHOP ON LEGAL RESEARCH AND WRITING TECHNIQUES

Synopsis:

To be familiar  with legal phenomenon  or to achieve  new insights into it, Legal research  plays an imperative role for the law students.  It also enables one to develop disciplined  thinking or  bent of mind. And To contribute in legal research, acquiring research skills is basic necessity. This idea was preached by Mr. Emran Azad in the first project of workshop series of the JULS Writing Club.  Emphasizing on research Ethics  he discussed the purpose, types and ways of legal writing. Afterwards, While discussing about referencing and editing,  he  conferred the basic  idea about OSCOLA, a Oxford University based legal citation in the programme.  However, Psyme Wadud thinks writing skills should be improved as the prior stage on the way towards researching.  And shared the processes and techniques a student should follow to write a legal piece.  She also talked about the importance of writing legal articles and gave a brief idea about different kinds of  legal writing in print media. The JULS writing club believes these workshop series  will be a toolkit to improve the basic skills of the students.

Date and Venue :
4th March, 2020.
Social-Science Faculty

About Speaker :
Mr. Emraan Azad, Lecturer in Law, Bangladesh University of Professionals

Psymhe Wadud, Lecturer in Law,
Bangladesh University of Professionals.
Also, Law Desk Assistant at The Daily Star.

Visit our event page:
Basic Workshop on Legal Research and Writing Technique

item.title: Call For write-ups
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Call For write-ups

“And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it and the imaginary to improvise.” 

Sylvia Plath

Have you heard this famous quote of Sylvia Plath? Opportunity is knocking at your door.

ARE YOU READY?

Here are the Author Guidelines 

 bit.ly/2YTZ323

Deadline : 15 JULY (For JUNE edition)

Contents: Any topic Connected to legal issues. (contemporary legal issues are highly preferred)

Word limit: 700-1000

NOTICE

  1. If we get too many similar submissions on a single topic, some may not be published even if they are of good quality
  2. In that case, the submission will be stored in paper bank and may get published in the following edition.
  3. Accordingly, we are not accountable if the paper loses relevance in time of publishing the next edition.

Contact : writing.juls@gmail.com

Visit Our Facebook page:
JULS Writing Club

item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Law is a discipline where the language is crucial. Language has to be precise, adequate and unambiguous in the legal discourse. To master the language as a skill, there is no match to the habit of writing. Therefore, writing it was, that JULS Writing Club endeavoured to encourage law students into. The Half Yearly Bulletin was one of the key prospects the club wants to introduce. It does not expect enormous expertise rather wishes to provide a platform to the novice legal minds and invite them into the habit of writing that shall lead them to the mastery of language someday. Half Yearly Bulletin is designed to accommodate and appreciate the early career pieces. The journey to the first issue of the Bulletin shall surely interest the readers. It hereby becomes a must to find a place in the forewords.

Jahangirnagar University law Society (JULS) Writing Club has a core ambition to facilitate and motivate law students into writing. Two of the issues that bar the enthusiastic students are i) feeling blank technically and ii) finding no food for thought. The club, therefore, started two distinct series to break the ice for the enthusiasts. One is the Basic Workshop Series, and the other is the Public Lecture Series. The first of Basic Workshop was on "Legal Research and Writing Techniques" held on 4th March 2020. With each member's immense effort, the workshop came out as a great success for the club. Next, the club arranged a public lecture on 8th March 2020, International Women's Day titled "The Gender of Constitutional Jurisprudence". The event got popular appreciation. The club prospects to run public lectures on a variety of intriguing topics.

The whole country has been in lockdown since March and everything became obsolete. Universities were closed. There was an unprecedented hindrance in regular activities. Yet, in this pandemic situation, the enthusiastic team members did not lag behind to come up with the proposal of publishing The Half Yearly Bulletin and started the work wholeheartedly. After getting an overwhelming response from the law students of different universities, the review team started the process of double-blind peer review. After a tough selection process based on review and plagiarism, only 11 paper could be accommodated in the Bulletin and a team of editors invested a huge amount of time for all the formatting and initial editing. Besides, a creative team assisted with the design and structure of the bulletin. Finally, with a final editing phase, ensuring the standard and maintaining the transparency of the writings, the club successfully completed its very first project of publication.

Gratitude cannot be expressed enough to our Hon’ble Advisor, Preeti Kana Sikder, Assistant Professor of Law, Dept. of Law & Justice, Jahangirnagar University. Even in a difficult time, she led us to where we stand today. Thanks must be given to our Hon’ble President, Md. Rabiul Islam, Associate Professor of Law, Chairman, Dept. of Law & Justice, Jahangirnagar University for the overall support with department resources. Lastly, we thank all the persons who directly or indirectly encouraged us.

Cover Page Attached below

item.title: call for write-ups December 2020 Edition.
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Call For write-ups

We are grateful to the audience as they recognised  the Bulletin June 2020 Edition with immense appreciation.

We feel majestic to announce that we are accepting submission  for December  2020 Edition. 

To Read our author guideline  click here

Deadline : 31 October,  2020 (for December  edition)

Contents: Any topic Connected to legal issues. (contemporary legal issues are highly preferred)

Word limit: 700-1000

NOTICE

  1. If we get too many similar submissions on a single topic, some may not be published even if they are of good quality
  2. In that case, the submission will be stored in paper bank and may get published in the following edition.
  3. Accordingly, we are not accountable if the paper loses relevance in time of publishing the next edition.

Contact : writing.juls@gmail.com

Visit Our Facebook page:
JULS Writing Club

item.title: Bulletin June Edition 2020
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Bulletin June Edition 2020

Law is a discipline where the language is crucial. Language has to be precise, adequate and unambiguous in the legal discourse. To master the language as a skill, there is no match to the habit of writing. Therefore, writing it was, that JULS Writing Club endeavoured to encourage law students into. The Half Yearly Bulletin was one of the key prospects the club wants to introduce. It does not expect enormous expertise rather wishes to provide a platform to the novice legal minds and invite them into the habit of writing that shall lead them to the mastery of language someday. Half Yearly Bulletin is designed to accommodate and appreciate the early career pieces. The journey to the first issue of the Bulletin shall surely interest the readers. It hereby becomes a must to find a place in the forewords.

Jahangirnagar University law Society (JULS) Writing Club has a core ambition to facilitate and motivate law students into writing. Two of the issues that bar the enthusiastic students are i) feeling blank technically and ii) finding no food for thought. The club, therefore, started two distinct series to break the ice for the enthusiasts. One is the Basic Workshop Series, and the other is the Public Lecture Series. The first of Basic Workshop was on "Legal Research and Writing Techniques" held on 4th March 2020. With each member's immense effort, the workshop came out as a great success for the club. Next, the club arranged a public lecture on 8th March 2020, International Women's Day titled "The Gender of Constitutional Jurisprudence". The event got popular appreciation. The club prospects to run public lectures on a variety of intriguing topics.

The whole country has been in lockdown since March and everything became obsolete. Universities were closed. There was an unprecedented hindrance in regular activities. Yet, in this pandemic situation, the enthusiastic team members did not lag behind to come up with the proposal of publishing The Half Yearly Bulletin and started the work wholeheartedly. After getting an overwhelming response from the law students of different universities, the review team started the process of double-blind peer review. After a tough selection process based on review and plagiarism, only 11 paper could be accommodated in the Bulletin and a team of editors invested a huge amount of time for all the formatting and initial editing. Besides, a creative team assisted with the design and structure of the bulletin. Finally, with a final editing phase, ensuring the standard and maintaining the transparency of the writings, the club successfully completed its very first project of publication.

Gratitude cannot be expressed enough to our Hon’ble Advisor, Preeti Kana Sikder, Assistant Professor of Law, Dept. of Law & Justice, Jahangirnagar University. Even in a difficult time, she led us to where we stand today. Thanks must be given to our Hon’ble President, Md. Rabiul Islam, Associate Professor of Law, Chairman, Dept. of Law & Justice, Jahangirnagar University for the overall support with department resources. Lastly, we thank all the persons who directly or indirectly encouraged us.

Cover Page Attached below Download the File Click here

item.title: lfr/afsin Ami/2n runner up
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations for being the 2nd Runner-Up!

The JULS writing Club congratulates Afsin Sultana Ami for being the 2nd Runner-up in the 1st Legal Film Review Competition, 2020. She wrote a review on the film "Aynabaji" which has caught the attention of the judges and hence, is selected to publish in the upcoming periodical of our club "The Half Yearly Bulletin December 2020 Edition". We wish her all the best to enhance the skill of writing.

item.title: lfr/md.eshtiaque/1st-runner-up
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations for being the 1st Runner-Up!

"Black and white won't attract much" this is how the review started, but it ended mentioning "if you dont like black and white movie, I would still recommend it to you" by satisfying the heart of the adjudicators throughout the whole writing. The JULS Writing Club warmly congratulates Mohammad Eshtiaque Hossain for being the 1st Runner-up in the 1st JULSWC Legal Film Review Competition. The club appreciates him for writing a remarkable review on the famous movie 'To Kill A Mocking Bird' and has selected the review to publish in the upcoming periodical of our club "The Half Yearly Bulletin December 2020 Edition". We wish him all the best to enhance the skill of writing. To read the review, keep an eye on our webpage for the notification of the Launching Event of the Bulletin latest edition.
Happy Writing.

item.title: lfr/abir.hasan/winner
item.dc:creator: writingjuls
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations for being the Winner!

Winning is always the toughest goal, one can heartily cherish. The writing has to be much appealing to persuade a judge to pick it as the best one. Hence, earnest congratulations to Abir Hasan Ananta for accomplishing this difficult task in a jurisprudential tone. The club appreciates him for writing a tremendous review on another famous movie '12 Angry Man'. Thus, for achieving the winning position in the 1st JULSWC Legal Film Review Competition, the club awarded him, by giving a chance to publish the review in the upcoming periodical- "The Half Yearly Bulletin December 2020 Edition". We cordially wish him all the best to enhance the skill of writing. To read the review, keep an eye on our webpage for the notification of the Launching Event of the Bulletin latest edition or follow us on Facebook.
Happy Writing.
